com.cyc.kb

Interface KBObject

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Assertion, BinaryPredicate, Context, Fact, FirstOrderCollection, KBCollection, KBFunction, KBIndividual, KBPredicate, KBTerm, LogicalConnective, Quantifier, Relation, Rule, ScopingRelation, SecondOrderCollection, Sentence, Symbol, TypeFact, Variable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AssertionImpl, BinaryPredicateImpl, ContextImpl, FactImpl, FirstOrderCollectionImpl, ForAllQuantifiedInstanceRestrictedVariable, InstanceRestrictedVariable, KBCollectionImpl, KBFunctionImpl, KBIndividualImpl, KBObjectImpl, KBPredicateImpl, KBTermImpl, LogicalConnectiveImpl, QuantifiedInstanceRestrictedVariable, QuantifiedRestrictedVariable, QuantifierImpl, RelationImpl, RestrictedVariable, RuleImpl, ScopingRelationImpl, SecondOrderCollectionImpl, SentenceImpl, SpecializationRestrictedVariable, SymbolImpl, ThereExistsQuantifiedInstanceRestrictedVariable, TypeFactImpl, VariableImpl

    public interface KBObject
    The top-level interface for representing objects in a Cyc KB.

      Does this correspond to any kind of Cyc assertion?

      Is this a non-decomposable KBObject? This will return true for KBObjects that represent Cyc constants, Cyc variables, or Cyc symbols.

    • Method Detail

      • getFacts

        Collection<Fact> getFacts(KBPredicate p,
                        int thisArgPos,
                        Context ctx)
        gets the asserted Facts visible from ctx, using the predicate p with this at position thisArgPos of the Fact

        Parameters:
        p - the Predicate of the returned fact
        thisArgPos - the position where this is found in the fact
        ctx - the Context. If null, returns facts from the default context DefaultContext.forQuery()
        Returns:
        a collection of facts, empty if none are found

      • getValues

        <O> Collection<O> getValues(String predStr,
                          int thisArgPos,
                          int getArgPos,
                          String ctxStr)
        This method gets asserted facts visible from ctx with predicate represented by pred and this at the thisArgPos arg position of the fact, and returns as O objects based on the arguments in the getArgPos argument position of the facts.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the objects returned
        Parameters:
        predStr - the string representation of the predicate
        thisArgPos - the argument position of this object in the candidate facts
        getArgPos - the argument position of the returned objects in the candidate facts
        ctxStr - the string representation of the context. If set to "", returns facts from the default context DefaultContext.forQuery()
        Returns:
        a collection of objects of type O
        See Also:
        for a method that returns the facts, rather than just the objects at a specific argument position of the facts.

      • getValues

        <O> Collection<O> getValues(KBPredicate pred,
                          int thisArgPos,
                          int getArgPos,
                          Context ctx)
        This method gets all facts with predicate pred and this at the thisArgPos arg position of the fact, as visible from ctx, and returns as O objects based on the arguments in the getArgPos argument position of the facts.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the objects returned
        Parameters:
        pred - the predicate of the facts
        thisArgPos - the argument position of this object in the candidate facts
        getArgPos - the argument position of the returned objects in the candidate facts
        ctx - the context where the facts are found. If null, returns facts from the default context DefaultContext.forQuery()
        Returns:
        a collection of objects of type O
        See Also:
        for a method that returns the facts, rather than just the objects at a specific argument position of the facts.

      • getValues

        <O> Collection<O> getValues(KBPredicate pred,
                          int thisArgPos,
                          int getArgPos,
                          Object matchArg,
                          int matchArgPos,
                          Context ctx)
        This method gets all facts visible from ctx that use predicate pred, have this in the thisArgPos arg position, and also have matchArg in the matchArgPos arg position; it returns a list of O objects from the getArgPos argument position of the fact.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the objects returned
        Parameters:
        pred - the predicate of the facts
        thisArgPos - the argument position of this in the candidate facts
        getArgPos - the argument position of the returned objects in the candidate facts
        matchArg - the object in the argument position matchArgPos
        matchArgPos - the argument position that must be filled with matchArg
        ctx - the context. If null, returns facts from the default context DefaultContext.forQuery()
        Returns:
        a collection of objects of type O

      • addFact

        Fact addFact(Context ctx,
           KBPredicate pred,
           int thisArgPos,
           Object... otherArgs)
             throws KBTypeException,
                    CreateException
        finds or creates a new Fact in the underlying KB

        The method finds a Fact in the KB with predicate pred, and this at the argument position thisArgPos, in the context ctx. The otherArgs specify all the arguments of the Fact, completely. If the fact specified by the input arguments is not found, creates and persists a new fact in the underlying KB. Note: Not all subclasses of the KB objects are directly assertible. For example, Sentence, Variable and Symbol need to be quoted, using Quote method, before they can participate in closed assertions. Note: The context is the first argument in methods that have variable number of arguments. In all other methods, context is the last argument.

        Parameters:
        ctx - the context where the fact is found or created
        pred - the predicate of the fact
        thisArgPos - the argument position of this object in the fact
        otherArgs - the arguments in positions other than p (0th argument) and argPos
        Returns:
        the fact found or created
        Throws:
        KBTypeException
        CreateException

      • getQuotedIsa

        Collection<KBCollection> getQuotedIsa()
        get all collections that the this object is a quoted instance of. The collections are instance of SubLExpressionType.

        All subclasses of KBObject can be quoted. Refer to #$NoteAboutQuotingInCycL for a more detailed discussion of quoting.

        Returns:
        the collection of KBCollections that this is quoted instance of

      • addQuotedIsa

        void addQuotedIsa(KBCollection col,
                Context ctx)
                  throws KBTypeException,
                         CreateException
        A quotedIsa assertion relates CycL expression to SubLExpressionType.

        All subclasses of KBObject can be quoted. Refer to #$NoteAboutQuotingInCycL for a more detailed discussion of quoting.

        Parameters:
        col - the instance of SubLExpressionType, the collection this is a quoted instance of.
        ctx - the context where the fact is asserted
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

        KBObject instantiates(String colStr,
                    String ctxStr)
                      throws KBTypeException,
                             CreateException
        creates a new Fact stating that this KBIndividual instantiates the #$Collection represented by col in the context represented by ctx. Effectively, this asserts (#$isa this col).

        Parameters:
        colStr - the string representing the KBCollection this individual is an instance of
        ctxStr - the string representing the context where the fact is to be asserted
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

      • instantiatesSentence

        Sentence instantiatesSentence(KBCollection col)
                              throws KBTypeException,
                                     CreateException
        This method returns the Sentence (#$isa this col). The key difference between this and instantiates(com.cyc.kb.KBCollection) is that, this method does not make any assertion in the KB. The sentence form of the assertion is generally useful when seeking user feedback before asserting into the KB. Use Sentence.assertIn(com.cyc.kb.Context) to assert the sentence in a Context.
        Parameters:
        col - the collection of which this KBIndividual is an instance
        Returns:
        the #$isa sentence between this and col
        Throws:
        KBTypeException
        CreateException

      • isInstanceOf

        boolean isInstanceOf(KBCollection col)
        Is this an instance of col in any context? This does not require that (#$isa this col) be asserted, merely that it be trivially inferable.
        Parameters:
        col - the collection which this may or may not be an instance of
        Returns:
        whether this is trivially provable to be an instance of col

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        whether this is trivially provable to be an instance of col

        Parameters:

      • isAsserted

        boolean isAsserted(Context ctx,
                 KBPredicate pred,
                 int thisArgPos,
                 Object... otherArgs)
        Is there an assertion in ctx with a sentence using pred, with this in the thisArgPos argument position, and with the arguments in otherArgs as the rest of its arguments? This method will not throw exceptions. Effectively, this is a wrapper around getFact(com.cyc.kb.Context, com.cyc.kb.KBPredicate, int, java.lang.Object...) that returns false if there are any exceptions. Note: The context is the first argument in methods that have variable number of arguments. In all other methods, context is the last argument.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which the sentence is asserted
        pred - the predicate of the candidate assertion
        thisArgPos - the argument position of this object in assertion
        otherArgs - the arguments other than pred and this
        Returns:
        true if and only if the fact is determined to be true.

      • getFact

        Fact getFact(Context ctx,
           KBPredicate pred,
           int thisArgPos,
           Object... otherArgs)
             throws KBTypeException,
                    CreateException
        find the specific existing Fact, in ctx, that has pred as its predicate, this in the thisArgPos argument position, and otherArgs as its other arguments. Effectively, this is inserted into position thisArgPos of otherArgs to form the arguments for a Fact that is searched for in the KB. If an assertion using that sentence is found in the context, the Fact is returned. If no such assertion is found, appropriate exception is thrown. Note: The context is the first argument in methods that have variable number of arguments. In all other methods, context is the last argument.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context of the fact
        pred - the Predicate of the returned fact
        thisArgPos - the position where this is found in the fact
        otherArgs - the arguments in positions other than 0 and thisArgPos. They have to be KBObjects or Java objects such as Date, int, float, String.
        Returns:
        the fact represented by the parameters in context ctx
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

      • getSentence

        Sentence getSentence(KBPredicate pred,
                   int thisArgPos,
                   Object... otherArgs)
                     throws KBTypeException,
                            CreateException
        construct a sentence, that has pred as its predicate, this in the thisArgPos argument position, and otherArgs as its other arguments. Effectively, this is inserted into position thisArgPos of otherArgs to form the sentence.
        Parameters:
        pred - the Predicate of the returned fact
        thisArgPos - the position where this is found in the fact
        otherArgs - the arguments in positions other than 0 and thisArgPos. They have to be KBObjects or Java objects such as Date, int, float, String.
        Returns:
        the sentence constructed by the parameters
        Throws:
        KBTypeException
        CreateException

      • addComment

        Fact addComment(String comment,
              String ctx)
                throws KBTypeException,
                       CreateException
        Add a new comment for this in the context specified

        In the CycKB comments can be added only on #$CycLIndexedTerms, which include CycLReifiableDenotationalTerm and CycLAssertion. An exception will be thrown if attempted to add a comment on Quoted terms, Sentence, Variable and Symbol. This means that only subclasses of KBTerm and Assertion can have comments.

        Parameters:
        ctx - the context where the comment is created. Cannot be null.
        comment - the comment string
        Returns:
        the fact created
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

      • addComment

        Fact addComment(String comment,
              Context ctx)
                throws KBTypeException,
                       CreateException
        Add a new comment for this in the context specified

        In the CycKB comments can be added only on #$CycLIndexedTerms, which include CycLReifiableDenotationalTerm and CycLAssertion. An exception will be thrown if attempted to add a comment on Quoted terms, Sentence, Variable and Symbol. This means that only subclasses of KBTerm and Assertion can have comments.

        Parameters:
        ctx - the context where the comment is created. Cannot be null.
        comment - the comment string
        Returns:
        the fact created
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

      • getArgument

        <O> O getArgument(int getPos)
              throws KBTypeException,
                     CreateException
        gets the object in getPos argument position of this KBObject as an object of type O. This method works for Sentences and Assertions, as well as non-atomic KBTerms. However, because a constant has no "arguments", calling this method on a KBObject representing a Cyc constant will result in a KBApiException.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the object type
        Parameters:
        getPos - the argument position of the object returned
        Returns:
        the object at getPos as a O
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException
        UnsupportedOperationException - if getArgument is called on Atomic terms. Do not use this to test for term atomicity, use isAtomic() instead.
        IllegalArgumentException - for a class of object types which do not support getArgument. Example include: Variable, Symbol

      • isAtomic

        boolean isAtomic()
        Is this a non-decomposable KBObject? This will return true for KBObjects that represent Cyc constants, Cyc variables, or Cyc symbols. It returns false for anything else.
        Returns:
        true if and only if this KBObject is not decomposable into other constituent KBObjects. For atomic assertions, or ground atomic formula, use instanceof Fact

      • isAssertion

        boolean isAssertion()
        Does this correspond to any kind of Cyc assertion?
        Returns:
        true if and only if this object is an assertion

      • isVariable

        boolean isVariable()
        NOT PART OF THE KB API 1.0
        Returns:
        the variable

      • getRestriction

        Sentence getRestriction()
                        throws KBApiException
        This method returns a sentence with the type restriction of the KBObject or its subclasses, even the ones extended outside of KB API. For example, restriction for KBPredicate object would be (isa #$Predicate). This is most useful for building sentences of KB Object typed-variables, for use in rules and queries.
        Returns:
        the restriction sentence for the class
        Throws:
        KBApiException

      • getQuantification

        List<Object> getQuantification()
                               throws KBApiException
        NOT PART OF THE KB API 1.0
        Returns:
        the quantification
        Throws:
        KBApiException

      • setQuantification

        void setQuantification()
        NOT PART OF THE KB API 1.0

      • formulaArity

        Integer formulaArity()
        Returns the syntactic arity of this object. If it has a relation applied to some arguments (i.e. it's a sentence, an assertion, or a functional term), the arity is the number of arguments. By convention, Cyc constants have a formula arity of 0.
        Returns:
        the arity of this object, null if not a Cyc constant, functional term, sentence, or assertion.
        See Also:
        CycConstant, Formula.getArity()

      • getCore

        Object getCore()
        provides direct access to the encapsulated object.

        This method should generally not be needed for application code, though it may be necessary is some rare occasions.

        Returns:
        the implementation-specific wrapped object

      • stringApiValue

        String stringApiValue()
        provides a version of the toString that is suitable for use when talking directly to a Cyc server via methods in CycAccess.

        The CycL output of each CycObject is required to interact with the underlying KB, for example, to find or create facts.

        Returns:
        the CycL string representation of the wrapped CycObject

      • delete

        void delete()
            throws DeleteException
        delete this term and all the facts using it in the KB.

        This will irreversible modify the KB.

        Throws:
        DeleteException - if the operation cannot be completed

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Returns false if the KB object behind this object has been deleted or otherwise rendered invalid on the Cyc server.
        Returns:
        false if the KB object behind this object has been deleted or otherwise rendered invalid on the Cyc server. Returns true otherwise.

      • rename

        KBObject rename(String name)
                throws InvalidNameException
        Change the name of this object to name. Throws InvalidNameException in cases where the rename cannot be completed, for any reason, one of the reasons could be that the name does not conform to Cyc constant-naming conventions. Among objects that cannot be renamed are non-atomic terms, assertions, and constant that are mentioned in server code. An UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown if attempted to rename Assertion or Non-atomic terms.
        Parameters:
        name - the new name
        Returns:
        the renamed KBObject
        Throws:
        InvalidNameException - if Cyc Server errors out for any reason, including invalid name
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the object being renamed is not isAtomic()

      • toString

        String toString()
        get the CycL representation of this as a String. This representation should be suitable for use with the KBObject factory methods, but may not be suitable for use with lower-level APIs. It should not be expected to contain "#$" constant-prefixes.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        the string representation of the underlying CycObject

      • toNLString

        String toNLString()
                  throws SessionApiException
        get the default natural-language string for this object.
        Returns:
        a natural-language string denoting this object
        Throws:
        SessionApiException
        UnsupportedOperationException - if unable to build a Paraphraser

      • getId

        String getId()
        Returns a stable, globally unique ID for this. In terms of Cyc-specific nomenclature, this Id is the compact, hl external ID for the underlying Cyc object. Generally the HL IDs of indexed terms #$CycLIndexedTerms are useful. Cyc can generate HL IDs for Sentences, Variables and Symbols.
        Returns:
        the globally unique ID

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • equals

        boolean equals(Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • equalsSemantically

        boolean equalsSemantically(Object object)
        Does this represent the same object in the KB as object. This can return true even if the two objects being compared are of different classes, as long as they represent the same object in the KB. Ideally if factory methods are used to create KB API objects, it will ensure that the object returned will be of the tightest subclass possible. So object comparisons will work even when cast to super.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to compare against this
        Returns:
        true if the underlying CycObject is the same for two different KBObjects

      • quote

        KBIndividual quote()
                   throws KBTypeException,
                          CreateException
        A quoted object refers to the object itself and not its meaning. For example, (#$Quote #$Plato) refers to the term #$Plato, and not to the philosopher. Refer to #$NoteAboutQuotingInCycL for a more detailed discussion of quoting.
        Returns:
        the quoted version of this object
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

      • getType

        KBObject getType()
        Return the KBCollection, as a KBObject, of the Cyc term that underlies this class. For example, calling this on a KBCollection object will return KBCollectionImpl.get("#$Collection").
        Returns:
        the KBCollection of the underlying Cyc term of the class.
